title: Clay valued at $3.1 billion in latest fundraise as AI continues to run hot
description: AI startup Clay has raised $100 million in its latest fundraising round, the company said on Tuesday, valuing it at $3.1 billion, as investors continue to pour money into artificial intelligence companies. The round was led by Google-parent Alphabet's independent growth fund, CapitalG, indicating industry validation for Clay's offerings. The round brings the company's total funding to $204 million.
content:
Clay valued at $3.1 billion in latest fundraise as AI continues to run hot

title: Exclusive -- President Trump Dismisses AI Economic Disruption Concerns
description: President Donald Trump told Breitbart News concerns over entry-level job losses due to the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) are misplaced, and there will be a surge in new jobs meant to build out the AI future.
content: MAIDENS, South Ayrshire, Scotland — President Donald Trump told Breitbart News concerns over entry-level job losses due to the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) are misplaced, and there will be a surge in new jobs meant to build out the AI future.... [2888 chars]

title: Productivity Commission says government must pause plan for 'mandatory guardrails' on AI
description: Standalone laws to govern artificial intelligence should only be considered as a last resort, the Productivity Commission warns, saying heavy-handed regulation could stifle AI's potential to add more than $116 billion to the economy over the next decade.
content:
The Productivity Commission has opposed the introduction of tough laws to control AI being considered by the government, warning its plan for "mandatory guardrails" should be paused until gaps in the law are properly identified.
The government has be... [5394 chars]

title: OpenAI, Google and Anthropic Win US Approval for Civilian AI Contracts
description: The US government’s central purchasing arm is adding OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Anthropic to a list of approved artificial intelligence vendors, opening the door to widespread adoption of the technology across civilian federal agencies.
content:
The US government’s central purchasing arm is adding OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Anthropic to a list of approved artificial intelligence vendors, opening the door to widespread adoption of the technology across civilian federal agencies.

title: I will always stand with the creator of the film: Farhan Akhtar on 'Raanjhanaa' row
description: Filmmaker-actor Farhan Akhtar on Tuesday said though he does not know much about what went into the AI-altered re-release of Raanjhanaa, his loyalty will always be with the creator of the film.Both director Anand L Rai and Dhanush, who made his Hindi cinema debut with the 2013 movie, have spoken out against production banner Eros Internationals decision to create an alternate happy ending for the movie through the help of artificial intelligence.Akhtar was asked about the controversy during the teaser launch of his upcoming film 120 Bahadur.
content:
Filmmaker-actor Farhan Akhtar on Tuesday said though he does not know much about what went into the AI-altered re-release of ''Raanjhanaa'', his loyalty will always be with the creator of the film.

title: DOST unveils faster, detailed AI-powered weather forecasting system
description: MANILA, Philippines — A new artificial intelligence (AI)-powered weather forecasting system promises to deliver faster, more detailed, and more localized reports than traditional models developed by the Department of Science and Technology (DOST)
content:

title: Abu Dhabi’s MGX Weighs Raising Billions for AI Investment Fund
description: Abu Dhabi-based MGX is considering plans to raise billions of dollars in third-party capital as it looks to ramp up investments in artificial intelligence, according to people familiar with the matter.
content:

title: AMD Under Pressure to Show AI Gains With Stock Beating Nvidia
description: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. earnings are expected to show the chipmaker is increasingly benefiting from the artificial intelligence arms race. The question is whether it’s enough to justify a rally that has outpaced Nvidia Corp.’s performance this year.
